title: Simple Machines Make Life Easier for Poor Farmers

tasks.task: Develop and test a hand-held planting tool for small-scale farmers.
subtasks: Design a long metal hoe with two flat teeth for planting seeds and applying fertilizer.
Incorporate features from existing tools, such as the hand planter from Brazil.
Improve the tool's efficiency, reducing seed and fertilizer usage and time required for planting.
Test various versions of the tool, refining it through multiple iterations.

tasks.task: Share the tool design with the global community.
subtasks: Publish plans for the tool on the Internet after completing development.
Collaborate with the International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center for dissemination.

MAINTASK: Develop and test a hand-held planting tool for small-scale farmers.
subtasks: Design a long metal hoe with two flat teeth for planting seeds and applying fertilizer.
Incorporate features from an existing hand planter from Brazil, which uses a V-shaped tool with a metal tip for soil disruption.
Optimize the tool to use less seed and fertilizer, reducing costs and time (halving planting time for a two-hectare farm).
Reduce the production cost from the current $200 to a more affordable price.
Test multiple iterations (four versions so far) to refine the device.

tasks.task: Share the tool design with the global community.
subtasks: Publish plans for the tool on the Internet.
Collaborate with the International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center for dissemination.
